bibl.title: The Temple at Ras el-Soda. Is It an Isis Temple? Is It Greek, Roman, Egyptian, or Neither? And So What?
bibl.note: The temple and its furnishings. - The dedication and dating of the temple. - Is it a Roman podium temple? - Classical style temples in Egypt. - Where does the inspiration for Ras el-Soda's architecture come from? - And so what?

bibl.title: Nile into Tiber. Egypt in the Roman World. Proceedings of the IIIrd International Conference of Isis Studies, Faculty of Archaeology, Leiden University, May 11-14 2005

bibl.seg: NAEREBOUT Frederick G., The Temple at Ras el-Soda. Is It an Isis Temple? Is It Greek, Roman, Egyptian, or Neither? And So What?

Laurent BRICAULT, Miguel John VERSLUYS and Paul G.P. MEYBOOM (Edd.), Nile into Tiber. Egypt in the Roman World. Proceedings of the IIIrd International Conference of Isis Studies, Faculty of Archaeology, Leiden University, May 11-14 2005 = Religions in the Graeco-Roman World. 159 (Leiden, 2007) pp. 506-554, 1 tabl., 7 figg.
